content:

L
Odd, just tried it from Windows Terminal (with a PL font) and Command prompt (without a PL font) via _genonce.bat and they were both fine for me. I'm running v1.0.2.
that is what I am running. Are you running current IG build?
windows terminal, running sushi alone, looks fine.
it seems just cosmetic, so not holding me up.. but I did take a second glance... and figued I should warn

Yeah, I get the nice border:
image.png

This is on my list to look at. It looks terrible in the CI build logs too (example). I think it is due to either the specific UTF8 characters we are using to draw the boxes or the coloring we apply. We may need to detect when it's launched from the publisher and do something different.
Just like the good 'ol days - terminal version arguments =)
Im all for getting rid of the cute graphics

@Gino Canessa -- that's definitely better, but the ? are still wrong, and look at the nice color it is missing. ;-)
image.png
(that turns red when there are errors)
Yep, I get that when run directly. The above image is from inside _genonce.bat

can anyone try to add this to their _genonce.bat - somewhere at the beginning, e.g. after the @Echo off
CHCP 65001
I'm not sure if we should change it in the script, though - because people may need to keep their characters and I do not know how universal is UTF-8
I seem to not have the problem anymore... My system did reboot due to patches manditory reboot... So maybe the problem simply went away

SUSHI 1.1.0 can now detect when it's running inside the IG Publisher, and in those cases, it uses only ASCII characters to print the summary. So... I think you should have a better experience from now on!
